bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to the governance of Villanova University. Included are records of the Province of St. Thomas of Villanova, the University Senate, the Faculty Affairs Committee, the Faculty Assembly, the Faculty Council, the Faculty Senate, and the Council of Deans. Records of the Province of St. Thomas of Villanova include programs, brochures, newspaper clippings, booklets on the Augustinian Bicentennial (1997), and materials relating to the separate legal incorporation of the Monastery (1978-1980). University Senate records include the organization's constitution and by-laws and directories. Faculty Affairs Committee records consist of minutes of the committee, reports, and correspondence (1967-1969). Faculty Assembly records include minutes of faculty assemblies (1970-1982), the Assembly's constitution, and correspondence and reports related to the faculty insurance plan, salary, and benefits. Faculty Council records consist of minutes of the Council (1982-1995) and lists of motions passed (1982-1987). Faculty Senate records include minutes (1995-1998) and a copy of a 1997 report entitled "For a Unified Faculty Voice in University Governance." Council of Deans records include correspondence (1969-1975), minutes (1969-1983), and reports on academic policy (1968-1973).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
